intro: Kingidium philippinense, commonly known as the Philippine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to violet. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous regions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
